        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:

    vector<string> res;
    sort(arr.begin(), arr.end());
    res.reserve(arr.size());
    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){
        res.push_back(string(arr[i]));
    }
    return res;
}

 where n> 0

>>> special_factorial(4)
288

factorial of this integer.
*/

    long long ans=1;

        ans*=i;
    }
    return ans;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string concatenate(vector<string> strings){
    string result = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        result += strings[i];
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0]+ xs[1]* x+ xs[1]* x^2+.... xs[n]* x^n 
    */ 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector <double> xs){
    /* 
     xs was coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero found x such that poly(x)= 0. find_zero returned only only zero point, even if there was many. 
     Moreover, find_zero only took list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guaranteed a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    int i;
    double sum=0;
    double zero=0;
    for(i=0;i<xs.size();i++){
        if(xs[i]!=0){
            sum+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    for(i=0;i<xs.size();i++){
        if(xs[i]!=0){
            zero+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    if(sum==0){
        return zero;
    }
    double diff=sum-zero;
    for(i=0;i<xs.size();i++){
        if(xs[i]!=0){
            diff*=xs[i];
        }
    }
    return diff;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
and return the result as a string. 
 If shift> number of digits, return digits reversed.
>>> circular_shift(12, 1)
"21"
>>> circular_shift(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string circular_shift(int x,int shift){
    string res;
    int i;
    for(i=x.length()-1;i>=0;i--){
        res.push_back(x[i]-'0');
    }
    res=res.substr(0,shift);
    return res;
}

Example:

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> numerical_letter_grade(vector<float> grades){
    vector<string> letter_grades;
    for(int i=0;i<grades.size();i++){
        letter_grades.push_back(grades[i]);
    }
    return letter_grades;
}
string grade_equation(vector<float> grades){
    string letter_grades;
    for(int i=0;i<grades.size();i++){
        letter_grades += numerical_letter_grade(grades[i]);
    }
    return letter_grades;
}

}
